title: Putonghua as a Second Language Taster Course for International Students
requirements:
Not for stu who have taken any CLCP courses (exceptCLCP1112,1113,1123) or any CLCC courses for PTH-speaking stu
From 2023-24, stu can only earn up to 2 units from CLCP1001,CLCP1101,CLCC1001,CLCC1101,JASP1350,HKSL1001,SPAN1001,GERM1001,KORE1001,FREN1001
description: “This course is offered via asynchronous online mode. Students should register the course via KEEP, a CUHK eLearning platform where the course materials are uploaded.”CLCP1001 is an asynchronous online taster course for international students who are interested in studying Putonghua. Students will be systematically introduced to Chinese characters (formation, history, stroke orders, etc.). Additionally, students will have a chance to learn some basic daily conversations in Putonghua.
outcome: Students are expected to:(PO1: for level 1) ask and respond to simple questions, convey minimal meaning, and satisfy a number of immediate needs based on everyday topics(S&L1) understand and reply to utterances containing selected vocabulary items and grammar points at the sentence level in daily conversations(R1) understand basic knowledge of Chinese characters (e.g. radicals, stroke order, etc.) and read commonly used basic vocabulary and phrases學生於完成本科時預期能：（學習成果：第一級）使用簡短問答應付日常生活中的基本需求(S&L1) 掌握基本詞彙，能聽懂日常生活中的簡短對話並作出回應(R1) 掌握漢字的基本知識（例如，部首、筆順等），能閱讀常用基礎詞彙及短語
syllabus: In this taster course, around 80 commonly used Chinese characters will be introduced in the context of basic daily conversations. The selected characters introduce some commonly seen radicals, such as the water radical, mouth radical, female radical, hand radical, etc. Topics covered in the daily conversations include: greetings, self-introductions, asking for directions, etc.
required_readings: Supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.
recommended_readings: Supplementary materials provided by the course teacher.

requirements: Not for students who have taken LEDC3520, CLED3530, CPTH3001 or CLCP3702, CLCP3703/CPTH3703 or above. Students are not allowed to take two levels of Putonghua in one term
description: An intermediate course in Putonghua designed for native speakers of Cantonese who already possess some foundational knowledge of Putonghua (including the Pinyin romanization system). title: Putonghua for Real-Life Communication (Formal Settings)
requirements: Not for Students who have taken CLCP/CPTH3703 or above
description: A non-credit-bearing Putonghua course designed to provide Cantonese-speaking local or non-local full-time undergraduate or postgraduate students with practical and comprehensive Putonghua training in a causal manner. The course will utilize task banks of the advanced and superior levels of the Computerized Oral Proficiency Assessment (COPA) developed by CLC in 2000, which provides virtual simulation contexts for students. They will be equipped with the skills to complete different language tasks with different functions and be able to communicate with various parties under various real-life situations. Students will also enhance their listening and speaking abilities and their awareness of contextual needs. Focus will be on listening and speaking skills. Instant and professional feedback will be given to students directly in class.
